thread.title: Luers QB Wezensky Out For Season with Knee Injury
thread.title_full: Luers QB Wezensky Out For Season with Knee Injury

title: Luers QB Wezensky Out For Season with Knee Injury
text:
Luers QB Wezensky Out For Season with Knee Injury 
By WISE Web Sports Luers QB Wezensky Out For Season with Knee Injury September 30, 2015 Updated Sep 30, 2015 at 7:50 PM EDT 
Fort Wayne (21Alive) -- Noah Wezensky was hoping to lead Luers to a state championship in his senior season, but he won't be getting that chance. Wezensky was injured early in last Friday's game against Carroll. MRI results came in on Wednesday and the QB has a torn left ACL, putting him out for the season. 
Wezensky missed some time early in the season with a foot injury. In 4 games he has 563 yards with 5 TD's and 2 interceptions. The Knights are 4-2 on the season and ranked 5th in 3A.
